title: Top Colleges in the Midwest by Size
sub_head: Carleton, Northwestern and Michigan are leaders in the WSJ/THE College Rankings
body:
Carleton College is the highest-ranked small college in the Midwest in the Wall Street Journal/Times Higher Education College Rankings, with Northwestern University leading the region’s midsize schools and the University of Michigan-Ann Arbor the top large Midwestern school.
The WSJ/THE ranking is based on 15 factors across four main categories: Forty percent of each school’s overall score comes from student outcomes, including measures of graduate salaries and debt burdens, 30% from the school’s academic resources, including how much it spends on teaching, 20% from how well it engages its students and 10% from its environment, a measure of student and faculty diversity.
